member.name: T:eDNAAdapters.DataType
member.summary: Defines eDNA data types.

member.name: F:eDNAAdapters.DataType.Analog
member.summary: Analog data type.

member.name: F:eDNAAdapters.DataType.Digital
member.summary: Digital data type.

member.name: T:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter
member.summary: Exports measurements to eDNA if the point tag or alternate tag corresponds to a eDNA point's tag name.

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.OutputIsForArchive
member.summary: Returns true to indicate that this is sending measurements to a historian, i.e., eDNA.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.UseAsyncConnect
member.summary: Returns false to indicate that this will connect synchronously based on eDNA API operation.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.PrimaryServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the eDNA primary server for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.PrimaryPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the eDNA primary port for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.SecondaryServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the eDNA secondary server for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.SecondaryPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the eDNA secondary port for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.Site
member.summary: Gets or sets the eDNA site for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.Service
member.summary: Gets or sets the eDNA service for the adapter's connection.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.AcknowledgeDataPackets
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if eDNA client API should acknowledge all process errors or protocol errors.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.EnableQueuing
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if eDNA client API should enable its memory queue.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.EnableCaching
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if eDNA client API should enable use of a local file system cache.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.LocalCacheFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename to be used for point ID map cache.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.ClearCacheOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if eDNA client API cache should be cleared on startup.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.RunMetadataSync
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this adapter should automatically manage meta-data for eDNA points.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.AutoCreateTags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this adapter should automatically manage meta-data for eDNA points.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.AutoUpdateTags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this adapter should automatically manage meta-data for eDNA points.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.TagNamePrefixRemoveCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of tag name prefixes, e.g., "SOURCE!", applied by subscriptions to remove from eDNA tag names.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.PointIDMapCacheFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename to be used for point ID map cache.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.DigitalSetString
member.summary: Gets or sets the default string to represent the digital set state.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.DigitalClearedString
member.summary: Gets or sets the default string to represent the digital cleared state.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.ValidateINIFileExists
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if eDNA client API INI configuration file should be validated to exist before starting adapter. When set to True, adapter will fail to start when INI file does not exist.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.MaximumPointResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time resolution, in seconds, for data points being archived, e.g., a value 1.0 would mean that data would be archived no more than once per second. A zero value indicates that all data should be archived.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.ConnectionMonitoringInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval, in milliseconds, to monitor eDNA connection. A zero value will disable the monitor.

member.name: P:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.Status
member.summary: Gets the detailed status of the eDNA output adapter.

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.GetShortStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a brief status of this
member.param: Maximum number of characters in the status string

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes this .

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.AttemptConnection
member.summary: Connects to the configured eDNA server.

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.AttemptDisconnection
member.summary: Closes this connections to the eDNA server.

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.ProcessMeasurements(GSF.TimeSeries.IMeasurement[])
member.summary: Sorts measurements and sends them to the configured eDNA server in batches

member.name: M:eDNAAdapters.OutputAdapter.ExecuteMetadataRefresh
member.summary: Sends updated meta-data to eDNA.
